alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:54AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway U, Greasy Creek at Farm Road 2290, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Purdy, Seligman, Exeter, Washburn, Shell Knob, Butterfield and Golden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
